name: DPLL SAT Solver
description: Davis-Putnam-Logemann-Loveland algorithm for determining satisfiability of boolean formulas in conjunctive normal form
when_to_use: Deciding if a boolean formula in CNF is satisfiable
Constraint satisfaction problems that can be reduced to SAT
when_not_to_use: Very large SAT instances (NP-complete, exponential worst-case)
When you need optimal assignments (SAT only answers satisfiability)
Problems better suited to specialized solvers (CSP, SMT)

complexity.time: O(2^n) worst case for n variables; highly variable with heuristics
complexity.space: O(n + m) for n variables and m clauses, plus recursion stack

parameters.name: formula
parameters.description: CNF formula as list of clauses (each clause is list of literals)

parameters.name: variable_ordering
parameters.description: Heuristic for variable selection (VSIDS, MOM, etc)

embedding_text: DPLL is a complete SAT solving algorithm that uses depth-first search with backtracking. Core techniques: unit propagation (eliminate clauses with one unassigned literal), pure literal elimination (assign literals appearing in single polarity), and systematic variable selection. Efficient SAT solvers add clause learning and watched literals. NP-complete problem but highly optimized in practice.
